user_review: Superb selection of fresh fish complimented by an interesting (if somewhat expensive) wine list. The value in the wine list lies in the deep selection of Portugese wines. The sommelier is very approachable and provides solid guidance across price points and pallat preferences.I have been to Ferreira twice and highly recommend the crispy octopus app. The signature black cod dish is also outstanding, but honestly I don't think you can go wrong with any of the fish selections. They have a variety of fresh fish on ice as daily specials so don't be afraid to go off menu!  The ambiance is chic/modern with house music playing in the background which makes for a great atmosphere. They have an open kitchen and it's really fun to watch the chefs work their magic on the line. On my second visit, my wife and I were seated at a two-top directly across from the kitchen and I highly recommend that table if you enjoy the show!

Located on Peel St, across from les Cours Mont-Royal, I had passed by this restaurant hundreds of times and never considered it a dining option. But I stumbled across it as I was planning my itinerary this recent trip to Montreal and was looking forward to well-prepared Portuguese cuisine.On a Sunday evening, the restaurant was packed, should I say, like Portuguese sardines (sorry, I could not resist). The happy guests created a joyful ambiance in both dining areas. We inhaled the crusty bread as we savored the grilled calamari appetizer and chatted about family, careers, and upcoming trips. The thick rings of meaty calamari were well prepared and served with a sweet puréed squash, complemented by the vinaigrette.Typically, I have duck when it is on the menu but I had already had duck two nights in a row and already knew duck was on the menu the following day. Luckily, I also love seafood bouillabaisse so I ordered it without hesitation or reservation. The cast-iron pot that arrived at the table contained large chunks of fish, plump langoustines, clams, and calamari, in a savory broth. While everything in the pot was tasty, the fish was particularly meaty and tender.For dessert, there was no doubt that I would have the Portuguese egg tarts. The dessert was actually one of the reasons I selected this restaurant. Two small bite-sized tarts, with flaky crusts and a brûléed top, were served with a spoonful of rice milk ice cream. How did I never have this; it was worth the wait!While our server was helpful and accommodating, there were too many guests the evening we visited so service was slower than I would have liked.

So I'll start this review off with the fact that eating out has become so difficult since starting the FODMAP diet back in April. I've learned I can't eat onions and garlic the two veggies that seem to be the base of everything!?!?! And we're my favorite, but if I don't eat them I feel so much better... ugh.So as you can imagine eating out with me isn't fun. So here we are on vacation, I'm trying to be careful but enjoy myself. Tonight was the night, I picked this restaurant off of yelp and being close to our hotel. What a great choice! We showed up at 8 pm on a Friday night with no reservations, were offered outside or at the bar inside. We picked inside at the bar. Comfortable highback bar chairs, and were able to sit down immediately. Restaurant was full and a bit noisy with talking and music, but definitely a cozy atmosphere. We ordered grilled octopus as a starter, and I informed the gal behind the bar of my onion/garlic dilemma. She guided me with the menu, even going back to the kitchen to make sure what was safe for me to order. We decided that the steak was probably the safest, and I was okay with that tonight. They also when bringing the octopus out stated "no garlic". Then they brought a tray with cod balls(they informed me I couldn't have these because they had garlic in them), cream cheese, tapenade and olive oil to go with this absolutely divine earthy brown bread (made in house-I asked). Then my Fred flintstone size steak arrived with a side of crisp frites and lovely seasoned broccoli/green beans/bok Choy. I have to tell you this was probably one of the best meals I've had out since this whole elimination diet that has restricted me. The steak and the veggies seasoned perfectly, frites crispy... I mean I couldn't finish the steak, but it was so delicious. If for some reason you happen to be on a low-FODMAP diet and are in Montreal, looking for a moderately higher end meal you won't be disappointed. This made me so happy!

Excellent food. Fun atmosphere - especially seated in front of the kitchen area where you could watch the hustle and bustle and see them prep all the different dishes of food headed for other tables.  I had the special that evening, which was a poutine topped with chunks of lobster prepared in a dark bisque.  It was interesting and was good - but the star of the evening was the sauteed shrimp appetizer in a garlic sauce.  Whole succulent shrimp with a sauce so good I mopped it up with sliced bread.

Aesthetic Appeal & Atmosphere:  Enjoyed outdoor sidewalk seating on a delightful Montreal summer evening.  It was a little cramped but it is big city lifeMeal Quality:  I ordered their Mushroom Duck Confit Risotto and a nice glass of Portugese Duoro and was very impressed!  Duck Confit is one of my favorite dishes and they met all of my wishes and expectations!  The Duoro paired very well and helped complete the mealService:  Was quite good in all aspects and the waiter was very efficient with pouring wineAesthetic Appeal & Atmosphere:  4Meal Quality: 5Service: 5

What a bustling place at lunch and it's no wonder! The food is delicious and you get an appetizer with your main dish. I started with the tomato salad followed by the pan seared fish of the day (Turbot fish). The fish was soft, tasty, not overly salty and served over a nicely made risotto.I wish I had room to try their dessert. Would love to visit again on my next visit to the city. The ambience is fun and very nice, the service at the bar was quick.

Dining out in Montreal's winter is not easy, especially where there is a cold weather advisory and it is -16C (5F) outside.  You've got to go to restaurants that are really worth it!The octopus appetizer here is absolutely divine.  One of my best bites in 2019 for sure!The carabinero risotto (it is called something else on the menu) was very tasty but there was something off about it at the same time.  The broth was rich and bursting with flavors but a bit too salty for me.  The fava beans tasted a bit strange but the strangest of all was the half cooked carabineros.  Not sure if they were meant to be medium rare but biting into a cold centre was weird, especially the brains... With that said, it is a very good meal overall.  I will return to try their black cod next time!

This is hands down my favorite restaurant in the area so far. I got a suggestion from American Express card about this place. The waiting staff was so friendly and they knew me by name. I made a reservation and wait time was 5 minutes. The tables and ambience was fancy. The staff was very helpful. I tried the oysters at first. They were very fresh tasting. The sauce was great. They had multiple choices for catch of day. I tried the branzino. The fish was very tender, flavorful a d fresh. It was one of the best fish dishes I had in a long time. Of note, they seem to be proud of their oil here. They provide some with bread in the beginning. And it was so good I had to buy a bottle from them. I will definitely come back whenever I'm in Montreal

Went back to this place because I had such a good experience the first time, and it was equally as great. I went with my boyfriend this time and he was extremely pleased as well. We got the sardines as an appetizer to start, and they were to die for. The sardines were grilled to absolute perfection and it was plated absolutely beautifully as well. And again, like the last time, I got the seafood casserole and it was just as good as I remembered, and stated in my last review, (my boyfriend thought the same thing).The flavours at Ferreira's have a nostalgic tinge to them as they remind me of my childhood and grandmother and mothers cooking. Going there is almost like a home away from home and is something that'll bring me back again and again. The service was also amazing. Our server was extremely attentive and overall knowledgeable with amazing suggestions. Like I said, I will come back here again and again, and I cannot recommend it enough.
Meh. Was Ok. I could hardly understand the waiter and it was noisy inside (as well as outside). Food was adequate. Small portions for fries. Not really worth the money.

Simply amazing service, food and ambiance. For starters I had a tuna tartare that was just perfect and had a perfect balance of seasoning. Then I enjoyed a lobster risotto that was cooked perfectly with mouth watering ingredients and a full lobster. Capped it off with. Portuguese Douro 2013 red. Simply enjoyable!
Go! go! go! The food is phenomenal, so is the staff and the service. Every dish we ate was outstanding! Don't pass this place up if you're in Montreal. They also have vegan options. It's a must go!!
Lovedddd this place!!! The food was DELICIOUS! Probably the best grilled octopus I've ever had with black hummus. The waiter was very nice and helpful. Very nice ambiance.

I don't know a lot of restaurant that's this jam packed on a monday lunch! I take this as a good sign as long as service is not affected and it was perfectly executed. Chapeau!I took the aragula and são george cheese salad wich was very tasty but from my collegues plate it was the octopus that was the most beautiful plate. For the main plate I took the cod, matane shrimps and spinach gratin. It was incredibly tasty and good but so filling! I ate half of it and was completely full. I'm not small eater normally and I love food so much I'd rather feel like a huge potatoe than leave good food on a plate. And yet, i sadly couldn't finish this. Overall, ferreira is a lovely place. Looks good. Feels good. Taste good.
Nice dinner on the patio. Green salad, halibut with lentils and a variety of veggies. Everything was good just not great. Service was excellent.

Last week I was watching TV and saw their commercial in the portuguese show. It looked really amazing so I wanted to try it. I went there on a Sunday evening. Its situated on Peel street, in front of Cours Mont-Royal. The inside is really pretty, great ambiance music not too loud  but enough to give it a nice mood.  I was able to have a conversation.As for the food, everything was amazing from the grilled calmari to the fresh salad, to the amazing rosted hen. Deserts we fantastic too, I suggest the taster platter where you get a variety of mini desserts. Staff was great, they even check-in your coat, which is fantastic specially with those big winter coats.I will definetily go back.UPDATEI went back a few weeks ago and it was even better than last time. I love the buzz and atmosphere in this place. Staff is great, food is delicious, you basically can't stop eating, it's that good. Very high quality food!!!! Love love love.

Three years ago I tried Ferreira and was a bit disappointed. This time they were up to the task.For the food aficionado who enjoy a good mix of taste culture and ambience, Ferreira Cafe combine all of the above.Located in downtown Montreal, a city known for good food and culture they fit right in.Try their always good bacalhau (salt) and for a affordable but excellent wine Douro Reserva "F" 2012 or 13 all good years.

Upscale Portuguese restaurant. Got a table in front of the kitchen, which was a lot of fun to watch. We ordered all appetizers: Roasted sardines, crispy octopus on black bean hummus, a seafood crudo special, the grilled calamari with squid ink crumble, and finishing with a green salad with burrata and pecorino cheese,. The grilled calamari was our favorite and most abundant with an entire squid. The special crudo was the most flavorful, and enjoyable. Our least favorite was the sardines which overpowered the other favors of the dish (could barely taste the horseradish). We have had Portuguese sardines before and this was not up to par. The best part of the dinner was our waiter, who spent a lot of time describing the dishes, cooks and restaurant - it was quite educational. Our second favorite restaurant on the trip (Tiradito was #1). Recommended.

Previously one of my favourite spots in Montreal but on my last visit a few weeks ago seems to have dropped a few notches.  It's a beautiful restaurant and is still popular, being nearly full on a Monday night.The food seems to have dropped a notch since I was here last.  We started with some very fresh but rather tasteless calamari.  I had a green salad, again, quality ingredients but rather lacklustre dressing.  I had lamb as my main, same problem, a very nice cut and well cooked but quite bland in presentation and flavour.  Nothing really wrong with any of the food, but for the price point really would have expected a little more "wow" factor and creativity.Service was friendly but a bit spotty.  Early in the evening was fine but as the restaurant got busy we had to chase our server for coffee and the bill.

Cute decor. Perfect place for a date or a group lunch or dinner. Good service, water is always filled up. Good lunch menu. Great dinner varieties. Each plate taste so fresh ! Loved it ! Went twice and would go back !

This was my last meal in Montreal after a wonderful JazzFest and it truly delivered!!! The waitstaff is very energetic, experienced and fun. The ambiance is great, the music gets a tad loud but it is also in keeping with the location and fun spirit of the place. Our meals (all very different) ranged from very good to sublime! The cod dishes were fabulous, the cocktails and wine list were spot on. It's a bit of a splurge but you absolutely get what you pay for in terms of food, service, menu and ambiance. Highly recommend.
we had good time the first time,the appetizers are so great especially the grilled calamari. The service here is perfect, thank you paul~~

Food: 5/5; Came here for lunch, which began with two slices of warm soft bread and the house olive oil, which was so pure-tasting. Ordered the crispy octopus for appetizer and the day's fresh fish, which was cod over a vegetable stew. Both dishes were perfectly cooked and seasoned. The cod especially was flaky and not outdone by the bed of roasted vegetables. Service: 1/5; I sat at the bar and my waitress/bartender was very demeaning. After being seated, I was approached by the waitress and asked if I was "going to have a big-girl meal at the bar," presumably because I was an English-only speaking out-of-town female eating alone in a restaurant filled by businessmen having lunch. I'm 30 years old. I didn't pay the pretty penny I did to be so belittled. And this demeaning waitress' case wasn't helped by the fact that 10 minutes later, a French-speaking female who appeared to be my age sat down next to me and was tended to with the utmost respect.So if you visit Ferreira and are served by a middle-aged woman with long brown hair, glasses, and a full set of corrective teeth braces, be prepared for rudeness.

I went with friends for dinner during the Montreal en lumière event( basically you have the choice of everyone taking that menu or going a la carte).  We chose to going with the table d'hôte because it was a nice variety In a 4 course menu and a good deal.  I have to say that it was a very long dinner for a 4 course.  We didn't get the first course until 1h into the service and it took at least a good 30mins in between each course.  First and last course were good, but the second course( the bouillabaisse) the seafood was over cooked and it was the same with the third course, the chicken was very dry.I do understand that when there are these types of events, it may be a little annoying to just cook the same thing, but you would think that because they are cooking the same thing, service would be better.Anyway, I still think I might go back and try the regular menu, but I'm on the fence after this experience.

I stop here at least once when I am in Montreal and must say their Grilled Octopus is simply the best. I actually just go there for this dish mainly and would not mind having it in my everyday diet if this place was not few thousands miles away from home.

So for my birthday dinner we decided to finally eat here. The food is really really good. I mean I'm a fan of seafood so it doesn't disappoint. The bill is hefty so that is just something to prepare for. Some people enjoy spending money on food others don't. This is preference.  The problem I have is this: service! If you are going to charge the amount you do and rate yourself as a high end dining establishment you have got to be spot in with your service. It took about an hour before the appetizers reached us and the same time before we got drinks. Main course was an other hour after that. It's a funny thing service it really has a way of not making you want to go back even though the food was very very good. This has to do with what high end dining has become : an experience ! You want the whole shebang especially when you are paying for it.
Very good fresh Portuguese food with an amazing and polite staff, always a good stop for lunch or even dinner. All around one of the best places to eat in Montreal. A must

Was with colleagues in Montreal for business and we asked at our hotel to recommend a good local restaurant that was not a chain and they recommended Ferreira Café which was a 10 minute walk from the hotel. When I looked it up on Yelp, I had already bookmarked it but had not tried it before. It was a Thursday night so it was busy but there were open tables for a party of 3. Our waitress was very helpful in explaining to us that they source a lot of fresh seafood directly from Portugal and that was their specialty. She recommended that we could share a fresh grouper and she brought it to the table to show us. For appetizers, we shared the grilled calamari, yellowfin tuna crudo and sautéed wild shrimp with garlic, white wine, lemon, and piri-piri.  For the main course, we shared the grilled whole grouper and the seafood bouillabaisse. We had bread with goat cheese, olive tapenade and olive oil to start. The yellowfin tuna app was the best. It was fresh and the flavours worked really well. The crispy chip on top gave the dish some texture. The wild shrimp was good too and had a bit of a kick to it. The spicy oil sauce from the shrimp made a good dip with the bread that was provided. The grilled calamari was excellent as well - tasty and tender. The grouper main dish was served whole and the waitress deboned the fish and served us at the table. The grouper was grilled with some salt and was excellent. It was so tender and meaty and seasoned perfectly. The grouper came with Brussel sprouts and vegetables on the side. We finished the grouper first before eating the bouillabaisse as that was kept warm in the Le Crueset dish. Our waitress then served us the bouillabaisse. The seafood in the bouillabaisse was very fresh and tender but the soup base was lacking some flavour. This was a bit of a disappointment after eating the amazing grouper. This was more than enough food for the three of us. For dessert, we had the Natas-these were vanilla tarts as well as the Floating Island. These were both very good. Overall, we all enjoyed the meal very much and agreed that this was a place for us to come back.

Great Portugese restaueant located downtown.I can't vouch for its authenticity since I don't eat authentic Portuguese everyday however I can most certainly vouch for how good the food tasted.I went all seafood save for the beef tartar and everybody was great. It was a beautiful restaurant with impeccable service, don't remember my server's name but he made the whole experience whole. Gave us good information and recommendation without being pushy at all. Will definitely out other dishes when I'm in town again.

We tried:Homemade grilled chourico: Delicious, would try again.Lamb chops: Meh. I've had better, I've had worse. Seafood Bouillabaisse with Lobster: Undersalted, the soup tasted like watered-down tomatoes with no flavor at all. Would not recommend for the price though I suppose it's a great date night place.
Perfect food! Amazing dinner! Tried the black cod, amazing! Filet mignon was also great, even not being the restaurant specials...Can't forget the desert... in the photo.

After the so-so dining experience here last time, my boyfriend and I decided to give this restaurant another try. This time, we went for the late night menu (available after 10pm) for $24. We got the soup and sardine for appetizer and chicken and tartar for main courses. I also got the passion fruit  mille feuille for dessert. The food was decent, but maybe because it was late at night? Everything felt very rough. The chicken was literally piled on a bunch of fries with very little presentation. Don't get me wrong, the tartar was fresh and the chicken was tasty. Maybe my expectation was too high for this restaurant. The service was worse than what I expected as well. We had to wait for the waiter to refill our water despite there were very little people in the restaurant. Short conclusion, food was good, service was just ok.

The starter and the desserts were really good, but the main course was not even worth finishing. We had both of the cod dishes on the menu. They both sounded so good and turned out to be disappointingly greasy and bland, and not even served hot out of the kitchen. The restaurant was very busy that night so maybe we got unlucky. Cold and greasy was not what we were expecting for such a nice place. The natas for dessert were absolutely divine, though! Service was excellent.

Been dying to go for years and husband finally took me for my bday. (He's not the biggest fan of Portuguese food. I know - how do you love someone who doesn't love olive oil, bacalhau cakes and pasteis de natas??) Anyway, I loved it! They fly their fish in daily from Portugal. Must have: octopus appetizer and black cod main meal. And if you dare leave without having a pasteis de nata, you don't deserve to go back.

Was very disappointed with Ferreira Cafe.  To start, my friend and I booked a reservation for the late night special and realized after that we were booked for the Valentine's Day special.  So we figured why not let's just go even though the reservation wasn't for what we asked for.  Our waiter was not attentive at all and honestly was rather inappropriate throughout our time there.  It was extremely uncomfortable that I found him staring at my chest the entire dinner.  We each got something different on the valentines special.  I got the octopus to start and it was overdone and the seasoning was rather odd--tasted like barbecue sauce.  My friend had the foigras which she didn't really like and our waiter made a comment when he came to clear the plate.  I had the prime rib which was again, nothing to call home about.  The ice cream for dessert was also very strange.   So from poor wait service and a below mediocre meal, it is insanely overpriced.  Our waiter even stood over our shoulder when we were putting in the tip and freaked out when one of us clicked "no tip" because we wanted to leave cash.  It was just overall very rude.  Also, the people at the table next to us ordered a paella type dish that was filled with lots of seafood and it smelled overwhelmingly, disgustingly fishy

Flew to Montreal for a few days from NYC. After doing some local research I found this place. Anyone coming to Montreal needs to come here. Excellent food and staff and I really enjoyed everything about my experience.Ingrid and Marilyn were behind the bar where I ate by myself and couldn't have been better from start to finish. They helped me navigate everything and I enjoyed it all. Grilled octopus then black cod, and finished with a pear caramel cake that was awesome. Dont know when I will be back to Montreal, but when I do, i will be back here..

We showed up 15 minutes early and the hosts would not find a seat for 82 year old patron with a cane! "Why don't you go to next door if you need to sit down " said the hostess. Worst ever treatment!However, the food is amazing

Came here without a reservation and they were able to seat us at the bar.The dishes were great!  Service was also REALLY great.We had the sardines as an appetizer which IMO was just okay.   It was good but something was off.  They were a little too salty.I ordered the seafood bouillabaisse and it was AMAZING.My husband had the seafood casserole which was like a cross between a paella and a bouillabaisse.  It was really REALLY good.  Filled with seafood and the rice was cooked just to the perfect texture.  Food portions were perfect - not too much, not too little.Would recommend to others.

The restaurant had a great atmosphere and an even better staff, this place was located on cool strip close to our hotel, outdoor seating was available, beautiful bar and an area to sit and watch the chefs cook up our dinner. This is must go to when in downtown Montreal. We had the grilled seafood platter and the black cod both were delicious.

The restaurant is best with its thoughtfully designed dishes, but the overall experience is weakened by the unthoughtful service, or simply the waiter that we have encountered.Fresh caught menu offers a pleasant surprise. We've ordered Mediterranean bass cooked in whole. The grilled fish is juicy and tender under crispy skin. Mildly salted and spices, the cooking brought out the essence of the fish's natural taste. The dish comes with a special salsa, grilled greens and mashed sweet potato. The salsa goes well with the fish because the overall sour taster and rich texture really invigorate the tasting buds, making the fish feels even more fresh and tender. The salsa contains some green peppercorn-like pickles in addition to the regular ingredients, and it is not soupy. The mashed sweet potato is richer and more interesting.The seafood Bouillabaisse is a potato-base soup with a variety of seafood and potato. It's adequate portion and it was brought in a warm le crueset cast iron oven. Well proportioned ingredients and fresh seafood make the dish better than similar dishes in other places, and it is a good choice for a winter my dinner.We've also tried the grilled calamari for appetizer. The calamari is of good quality and grilled to a turn, but tastes a bit bland in itself. The green sauce is herbal and bitter, yet complemented with the sweet orange color sauce, giving dish quite an interesting flavor. Now comes the downside. The waiter is rather unresponsive and cold, offering very little suggestions and make us feel that he does not care. The bread offered before appetizer is cold and tough, quite disappointing comparing to the level of the cuisine this restaurant would like to boast.

Ok, I might take back all of my reviews  down one star from the past restaurants I visited in Montreal because this one was the best! Our waiter Laurent was full of knowledge and was very pleasant to speak withAnd helped us pick the best every step of the way. From the beginning to the end the food was amazing. Even the olive oil was to die for. We ordered a bottle of Vhino Verde by Anselmo Mendes. Very smooth and not too much on the sparkling side. For food we ordered the grilled calamari ( must have!) and entree the black cod and the steak. The black cod was a hit! If you come here you must have this dish. For Dessert we had the chocolate moose! We also got to try a Dessert wine named Muscatel. Very good as well not as sweet as a port. Don't miss out on this wonderful restaurant.
Terrible service and food. Waiters were rude and when we mentioned at the end of the meal that we were disappointed they did nothing and didn't even apologize.

Let me start by saying I love Portuguese food and have gotten the chance to try some great Portuguese restos in Montreal and while I did like this one I have some mixed reviews. The food itself was very well presented and the ingredients were fresh but there was nothing that really stood out especially given the prices I can't say I was blown away by the food. We tried the beef tarter ,seafood bouillabaisse , squid ink risotto and creme brûlée dessert - all the dishes were very beautiful to look at and the ingredients were fresh BUT Portuguese cooking is all about bold bright flavours and all the dishes were enjoyable they were all lacking that little extra something to make them memorable. Our server was friendly and came to check on us frequently , he also made a great wine suggestion to pair with our order. However , there was a man in a suit who I assume was maybe the manager that would also come around and check on the diners and ask us if we needed anything , we asked for more bread for the bouillabaisse and he seemed annoyed which I didn't like. The decor was very nice and elegant and perfect for a date night (they also offer outdoor seating during warmer seasons). I'm happy I finally tried this place but can't say that I plan to go back any time soon .

Appetizers were excellent. Octopus, tuna tartar and sardines were all excellent. Main dishes (whole fish sea bass and black cod) were both very good, but not the same level as appetizers. Service was terrific, very nice room / ambiance. Exceptional weather allowed folding front doors to be open, which added to the ambiance. Overall, a very solid restaurant experience.

Beautiful place with excellent food and service! Grilled sardines and black cod were very, very good! Entree was slow coming out due to a large party but otherwise it was exceptional. I highly recommend Ferreira's!! I had dinner at the bar and service was excellent - thank you Veronique and team!

We had a recommendation of this place from one local, while visiting Montreal. The food is marvelous, the ambience is refined and cozy at the same time, service impeccable! You feel like a royal by the treatment received. Your glass of water is always full, you don't even need to ask for salt pepper or another glass of wine, cause the server was prompt right there to anything else we might need. I had the fish of the day, which tasted delicious right temperature perfect preparation. Great selection of Portuguese wines too. I would return any other time I will visit Montreal and HIGHLY recommend to anyone that would like to experience a great time with fantastic food.

Came here around Christmas last year.We had their Christmas roast piglet. Quite a spectacle with the pig being carved on your table. There was some kind of extremely tasty potato and liver stew that came alongside the pig as well. The rest of our meal was great as well.Dessert was the low point of the meal, I've had better pasteis de nata at most of the Portuguese rotisseries in town.

Came here late on Valentines after another place. Sat at the bar and the server there was awesome, super friendly, knowledgable and helpful.She explained the menu and how the fresh fish system works with the weights, filleting, types of fish etc.We ended up getting her octopus appy recommendation, and the daily catch. She recommended a Portuguese fish that's very popular at the restaurant, saying that it has a slightly nutty flavour. I forget the name but I will post a photo of it.The octopus appy was delicious, perfectly cooked. Beautiful texture and flavour.Then came the fish which is filleted and served Infront of you after it's cooked. The fish was incredible, it was moist, fatty, flavourful, kind of silky in a way. And the veggies and sauce to go along with it matched well. We really felt spoiled and lucky to have gotten a seat there.If ever back in Montreal, we will be eating here again. Great restaurant - decor, ambience, cleanliness, service and food....all wonderful and very well done.

We came to Ferreira during our visit to Montreal. We were a party of 2. Seated promptly, The place was jam packed on this saturday evening.We had filet of Sardines and a tostada. Filet mignon which was pretty small. And the best dish was a whole grilled silver Porgy fish. It was great and better than our usual med seabass. The service was simply perfect. I highly recommend

Excellent experience - sardines for appetizer , sea bass and black cod for entrees. Fish is flown in several times a week from Portugal. Preparation is excellent - lots of flavor but not overpowering. Pricey but worth it

Has to be the best meal I've ever eaten in Montreal. What a nice surprise from a last-minute decision on a Friday night!I am more used to New World wines, and found the wine list challenging to interpret. Our waiter didn't seem too fussed about explaining some options. Service in general was a little reserved, but this could well have been because we were speaking English to a very francophone staff.We started with the charcuterie board, which was notable for a really delicious duck terrine. Pleasantly, the capers and olives were quite good quality on their own, not just space fillers. I had the porcini-encrusted black cod, and kind of felt like crying when it was gone. This was some of the best fish I've ever eaten. Beautifully cooked, silky and rich and light all at once. The mashed potatoes and mushrooms on the side were also outstanding. The few bites I had of the duck confit and mushroom risotto were gorgeous, and I say that as a firm risotto avoider.This was not a cheap meal, but it was worth every cent. Unlike some pricey meals, which are made up of a few bites on a series of plates, I was honestly too full for dessert by the end of the evening (which I was disappointed about, because the desserts looked great).Quick recommendation: visit the women's bathroom and use the homemade olive oil scrub. Such a random and luxurious offering!My one tiny complaint is a sexist vibe I got from a waiter who came to refill my wine glass and said mine must be empty while my boyfriend's was full because I'd been "talking away." An annoying comment at any time, but especially grating when you're at a nice restaurant and feel it's not the place to make a scene.

First of all, kudos to the kitchen. You turned out some great looking and delicious food.On the other hand, the service seems to be hit or miss.For us, it was a total miss: a strike out looking, an air ball, a butt fumble, a breadbasket.Speaking of breadbaskets, a dungeon master would bring bread out to prisoners with morecivility than the staff at this cafe.

Apps very good. Entree mediocre. Service poor. Manager who seemed to be the owner did not show any concern of our poor experience. Communication at this place is horrible. Fist time at a Portuguese restaurant and was not taken the time to explain to us and seemed irritated with us for asking questions and basically walked away without explaining any further. Wait time for apps and entrees were about 45 minutes in between. Waiting for our check another 45 minutes. What a waste of our time (on vacation) so left with no time to explore the rest of the night. Left the place still hungry. It was the most awkward experience we've ever had in our lives.

It was my wife's birthday so I decided to take her on a small trip to Montreal to celebrate (we're from Toronto). She's really enjoys Portuguese food so I decided to take her to Ferreira, it seemed like a no-brainer. Looking back at it now, I wish we never went there. The food was fine, I will give them their full credit there. The seafood was prepared very well, especially the octopus in our starter, the grilled seafood for two. It was crispy on the outside and soft (not chewy) on the inside.The problem with our experience was with the service. This evening was supposed to feel special for my wife, but we were forgotten by our server so often that we felt anything but.Despite them being notified (via the notes section on the online reservation form) that it was my wife's birthday we experienced the following:- 20 minutes to get a glass of wine (it would have been longer if I did not remind our server)- Our sides came so long after our mains that we were left with cold seafood casserole and hot vegetables.- We asked for more bread, but it never came (it seemed to find its way to the table beside us when they asked, though) - Even when we asked for the bill (we just wanted to get out of there) we were left out to dry until I decided to remind our serverAfter we paid (a $185 tab) we made our way to the door. Our server stopped me and admitted, "I'm sorry I've left you hanging all night." I shook his hand and walked out with my wife. Outside, I turned to her and admitted, "I'm sorry that I brought you here."Maybe you feel like I'm being a bit dramatic here. Trust me, I'm not the type. If this is just me and the guys on a regular night out, sure I can suck it up. Joke about it, talk a little trash maybe. Definitely not take the time to write out a review. But I ask you, how am I supposed to feel when I see the look on my wife's face gradually go from excitement and anticipation to that of a woman who feels forgotten and unimportant on a day that she holds dear? If I am asked to recount the experience, how can I not call to attention her dissatisfaction?So because of that I cannot, in good conscience, recommend that anyone give Ferreira their patronage. The quality of their food cannot make up for the disappointment that is their service.

Hands down one of the best restaurants in Montreal, not only highly recommended by the locals, my entire party throughly enjoyed their meals. It goes without saying that this restaurant is very upscale and formal, but they also have outdoor seating which is rare for a good restaurant. The portions are small for their price but the delicious tastes make up for that. If you're visiting Montreal or live there i highly recommend the Ferreira Cafe !

My husband and I stumbled on this small restaurant downtown because of the jam packed terrace. Once I saw black cod on the menu, I immediately decided this was our dinner for the evening. The inside is pretty small but great ambience and cozy feel. We sat across from the open kitchen- which I love seeing! We were greeted by a super friendly and patient server. We ordered the octopus appetizer which we both enjoyed. The black cod was ok- a bit bland,  but I really loved their Portuguese salsa I ordered on the side! My husband ordered the seafood bouillabaisse with a lobster mixed in. He was disappointed with the small quantity of the lobster but overall he liked his dish. Not a bad place to try out for an evening of splurging if only for the ambience and great service.

Wonderful staff and decor. Fancy looking fancy expensive but not tasty. For the interior looks I would give 5*, but you don't give stars just for that. Food is very very below the average. Tried lots of things there hoping for the better flavor, but I'm disappointed. There are missing the absolute Portuguese classic flavors. The seafood for two is ridiculously over priced - 1. Such small portion (cold & hot)  and the hot version which you'd expect would have some interestig flavor - shockingly it is not tasty at all. 2. Fried calmari starter is the poorest quality choice as well. 3. And sizes are super duper tiny, not only in options for two. I'm a Seafood/Portugese Cuisine lover so the fact that they lack on at least one solid  traditional butter-garlic tasty seafood is very disappointing. Better to not go there and fly to Lisbon instead, that's how expensive and low value it is. Feeling bad also for the absolutely beautiful and sweet waitresses , for they are wasting their lives there, they should move to Hollywood or get into serious modeling or acting carrier. Service was great. That is the ONLY plus there can be. Disappointed with the tasteless and unlike the Portuguese food, and would not want it for free if someone wanted to offer it to me. I do not recommend this absolutely overpriced place.

Love the romantic ambience of this seafood-centric Portugese restaurant. Complimentary bread - yum with olive oil Started off with grilled seafood for 2 (shared amongst 4 people) - large prawn, lobster, scallop, octopus in delicious garlic parsley sauce. Everything is so fresh, large portion and cooked perfectly. Bouilliabaisse  - seafood soup, actually not much soup, but again the seafood was good. Seafood Rice - love this the most, the flavors (tomato, saffron??) can't find anywhere else. Rice is a bit hard for my personal taste but love the sauce and the meaty seafood. For dessert we had warm fig cake with sweet potato icecream. The cake reminds me of sticky toffee pudding, not too sweet. No sweet potato taste in the icecream, but just as delicious with a cinnamon flavor. I liked this more than the creme brulee.

I rarely do review, but I'd make exception for Ferreira.It was simply a great dining experience. I came for late lunch and asked to be seated outside in the patio. Ordered the oysters, bouillabaisse and egg tart. The bouillabaisse is simply divine - the broth is not as buttery as other bouillabaisse, and the taste of the il mare/ all the seafood medley is just beyond my expectation. The fruit tart is also so good, even for myself who isn't into sweets as much. Highly recommended!!

In town for a work conference and a local Montréal associate recommended Ferreira to us as we were hungry for seafood.  Reservation here is a must here.  Very popular restaurant as the place was very full when we arrived.  Super chic interior design and trendy clientele, coming largely from the business district.  Waiter was attentive at first for appetizer course.  Small menu but we found the dishes we ordered spot on flavor-wise. Nice choice of wine by the glass.  I had crispy octopus as app and it was delicious - tender, crispy and ocean salty -perfectly cooked.  Had whole-roasted sea bass as an appetizer and it was perfectly cooked.  Food server expertly deboned the fish table side.  Moist, juicy and perfectly seasoned.  Unfortunately for us, at this point a party of 16 was seated near us and we lost our waiter.  He was hard to track down at this point.  We enjoyed a couple more drinks and headed out after dinner.  Would have struck around for dessert but we our waiter was otherwise occupied by the 16.  He was attentive early on and we did enjoy our meal and service overall.

I am a sucker for good bouillabaisse, and as I walked past Ferreira's at noon, I noticed it on their menu and made arrangements to take my wife there for dinner.The restaurant is what I would call "fancy", so it's not really the type of place you'd take children to, and it's priced on the higher end, and not really the type of place you'd go to in blue jeans.The wine list seemed a little pricy for the quality but it's what you'd expect from this type of restaurant.For starters I ordered the grilled calamari, which was the star of the evening. The calamari was prepared so tenderly that it tasted like lobster, and was presented beautifully (picture attached). For my main course I ordered the bouillabaisse. The bouillabaisse was good, but lacked depth of flavor. It wasn't bad, but I expected more after having such an exceptional appetizer.My wife ordered a steak (a filet). There was no option to order a petite stake (under half a pound), so she went with the big one. The steak was well aged and was tender and tasty (one big steak), with accompanied veggies.The service was excellent.All in all, it was a good meal, we tipped the server well, but it didn't rate a return visit.

Unfortunately this was the only bad review I had in Montreal.The good. Really nice place. Decor was modern and chic. Looks like the place you'd take a date or pre-game.The bad. Served by a woman who was more interested in the table next to us. Took 5 mins to get a menu. Another 5 mins to get tap water (which she poured into our wine glasses as she was still watching the table next to us). We ordered and was told we just ordered too little. Fair enough I guess. So we said, let us rethink our order, give us a minute. For the next 15 mins we tried to call her over, but again she was still too busy with the other table... We were invisible.  Enough was enough, so we picked up our stuff and walked over to her and told her we were leaving. She paused and said she had already ordered our food... Wtf.  Finally a manager walked over and asked us if everything was ok . Our waitress came over... Now all smiles with the manager with us... And said she cancelled the order. Great work. Useless. Ordered pizza. Shit way to finish your last night in Montreal.

This is what very good art tastes like! Excellent service, excellent attention to detail, good selection of entrees, excellent desserts! 5 of us enjoyed a surprisingly great meal this evening. The oysters were amazing! The beef tar tar was killer! From there we enjoyed the filet, seafood rice, duck with risotto and cod. The vanilla & chocolate natas were off the charts amazing for dessert! A great port selection- we enjoyed the Tawny port tonight.

Ferreira is one of the most reliably good restaurants in downtown Montreal. The fish is always fresh, perfectly prepared and wonderfully presented. The wait staff is experienced and provide consistently excellent service.  I've never been disappointed eating here. The only challenge is deciding what to order. When the waiter arrives at your table he will list all the fish available that day and it seems that ever time I hear something I think "yes that sounds great I'll have that" and then I hear the next thing on the list and I think the same thing. By the time we arrive at the end I have to ask the waiter to start again because there were so many things I wanted I can't remember the first ones that were mentioned. Don't forget to save a little room for a pastel de nata, a Portuguese tart.

So I've always passed by this restaurant on my way to the gym and I've wanted to try it. I like my high end restaurants, this is no secret...and last night I've finally got to go! Yay!Good : My side salad and the salmon was really well cooked. Decor is nice, the plating was excellent. Bad : I'll start off with a really awkward seating arrangement. I had to squeeze through a tight space of two other tables to get to my seat by the wall. Fine, I can put up with that. Bread took 20 minutes to arrive. Okay, let me just carb up now because if it takes that long to get bread, I can't imagine how long the appetizers will take. When my sardines appetizer arrived, it came with a weird jelly/fish paste thing on the bottom that looked like smoke salmon. I took a big scoop of that deceitful smoke salmon jelly looking thing (in my defense, I thought it was smoked salmon) and it was probably one of the worst decisions of my life (besides art school). I've ordered the Churrasco style cornish hen as my main course...and quite frankly, it was really dried. Maybe I came in with really high expectations, but I've had better chicken at Romado's for half that price. Bottom line : Water will cost you $5 and it won't come in a Fiji bottle either. Not exactly a good experience, not quite the best Portugese food, not likely returning either.

Returned to Ferreira and was thoroughly disappointed.  Food was still good, but service was clearly lacking.  It took forever to receive my order and when it finally came it wasn't what I had asked for.  The waitress wasn't terribly apologetic and nothing was discounted from the bill.  ---Was visiting Montréal for a conference and had Ferreira Café recommended to me as the place to go for quality seafood in Downtown.  I sat at the bar and was delighted with both my appetizer and entree. Save this for special occasions as it isn't exactly cheap.

My parents were raving about the black cod  in this place and so I had to go try it! Cooked to perfection over a bed of mashed potatoes and wild mushrooms with a sweet brown sauce all placed in a bowl. Absolutely delicious. I also tried the grilled calamari and the lobster and crab salad. Both also delicious, but the black cod was by far the best. Will definitely be coming back!

We came here for dinner on our last night in Montreal. The service was horrible - our waitress seemed clueless. We were seated by the glass wall looking into the kitchen (cool). It took a little bit to give our drink order, then longer to actually receive them. We ordered  oysters to start followed by the grilled seafood platter for two. The oysters were nothing to write home about, especially after it took about 40 minutes for them to come out. The grilled seafood platter was smaller than we imagined, and when it showed up to the table it was missing the octopus. Overall the food was decent, nothing special, and the service was absolutely atrocious.
The food was delicious and service fine, but my evening was kind if ruined when the waiter scoffed at our 15% tip.

Very pretentious restaurant that probably runs on its reputation. Food was ok but way overpriced. Cornish hen was mostly bones. Waiter took advantage of the fact that there were kids and ask them directly if they wanted a 2nd glass of coke without checking with parents. Water service was good but the rest is very pretentious. Had a tiny bug in wine glass which was 3/4 full. Waiter brought a new glass without apologizing and simply poured wine from the bottle we had purchased without offering any kind of apology...wasted almost a glass of wine. Most ironic thing is that despite the fact they are so pretentious, they didn't know how to properly cut a two-tier cake (although they charge 4$ per person for service of the cake)...they ended up ruining a 150$ cake (see pictures).

Came here for the 10 pm late night menu with friends. For apps we had the grilled calamari, fried calamari, and sardine. The grilled calamari was the best. Entree we had salmon, steak, and seafood soup. The salmon was huge, so it's pretty worth it. The steak was good but a little too raw even though I asked for medium.  Overall the decor is nice and restaurant has great ambience. Everything for $25 !! Totally worth it

We went to eat here for their late night menu, from 10PM to close, on Monday-Saturdays. Man, it was awesome! The sardines have to be the tastiest sardines I've eaten, and damn, that octopus? Worth every extra penny. It tasted like sous vide unicorn horns, in a savory chili oil. Woowee. The flank steak was cooked perfectly and the duck confit risotto? Forget about it. Montreal people have it good.
Loved the food!!!It was a delicious meal and the dessert Natas took the prize.Fresh seafood and amazing dessert...can't go wrong!!

I enjoyed this beautiful restaurant during my recent business trip to Montreal, and I'm happy that I made it one of my choices. In a city of French food, this Portuguese restaurant stands out with its commitment to fresh seafood. I sat at the bar and enjoyed a wonderful wine and the seafood rice. The rice was delivered to my plate in a very large pot. The bartender served me portions from this pot until I had cleaned it. The rice was filled with meaty and yummy chunks of seafood: clams, mussels, and shrimp. The juices of the seafood mixed with the rice created a paella-like dish that was delicious.The food here is a bit expensive, but the quality and the service were top notch.

Fabulous! We go out every year with a group of friends over the holidays. We chose Cafe Ferreira this year & it did not disappoint! The service from start to finish is impeccable, lots of attention to detail. Great wine list. A few of us have food allergies & meticulous detail was taken by the kitchen & wait staff to ensure we would be safe & still enjoy, and we did! The food is exceptional. The meats, cod, crispy octopus... Dessert tasting platter, all were amazing. We will return again soon!

Not sure where the great reviews come from? Maybe tonight was an off, VERY off night? The restaurant itself was very nice, however the service and food left much to desire. We started with the grilled calamari which was just ok cooked well but lack of flavour. For my entree I had the highly talked about black cod which is served on a potato purée. My first bite of fish threw me off and realized I must have taken the potato by mistake... No it was the cod. It was complete mush. My husband and I are huge fish and seafood fans and both of us could not eat this fish. We would have complained had our waiter shown back up at all, we finally had to get up and to let someone else know we were not happy and would like the bill so we could leave. The apology was barely there and awkwardly dealt with, however the fish was not on our bill. We would not return to this restaurant.

The ambience and restaurant is very nice and classy. Service was excellent. I had the salmon with vegetables which originally isn't on the menu on Sunday's but they still accommodated me. I would go again

So glad a local contact recommended Ferreira Cafe to us, an amazing first night in Montreal meal!Ambience is slightly upscale but not formal or stuffy. Broken plate wall is a great touch. Aperitif from the host for a slight wait in our reservation was a class act.For appetizers we had the grilled sardines and the seared Tuna. Both were excellent. The sardines were prepared very classic and simple with olive oil, salt capers and oregano grilled with a slight char, perfection!  The tuna was seared with a Peppercorn crust, raw center and was perfect.For my entree it had to be the black cod. The cod was light, tasted like a sweet buttery almost dessert like dish and was placed atop potato purée. While eating it was sometimes difficult to tell where the cod finished and the potato started. A wonderful dish finished in a wine reduction with porcini mushrooms. I would say this is a must order dish.My favorite meal in Montreal for sure and based on the crowds I saw there there the next afternoon while strolling by, I say it's a favorite for many locals!
Really good Portuguese Resteruant, daily fresh fish! Nice presentation, good advise from waiter! Love the scallop and grouper!

A classic, almost old world ambience permeates this downtown restaurant, which is nicely set off by youthful, enthusiastic staff.  Most of the diners seem to be well-dressed foodies of a certain age, but there were families too.  I can see this place being a "go-to" for locals, as they offer lots of meat dishes in addition to their fish and Portuguese specialties. Something for almost everyone.  Eating alone, I had a great view of the restaurant from my secluded corner. Service is excellent, as is the food, though I would say portions are small for the price. I started with 6 oysters from the Madeleine Islands, which were creamy and perfectly briny, well joined with a glass of Albariño.  For my main course, I was in a pickle, as the fresh fish selections all sounded irresistible , but I went ahead with my initial choice, the seafood and rice stew, with added lobster. This is a delectable dish and I ate every morsel. There's a bit of piquancy that really adds to the dish but it's not too spicy to overwhelm other flavors, or put you off. The Shrimp, clams, calamari  & scallops are all nicely done.  My server forgot to add the lobster, however, and that came about 7 minutes later, along with a complimentary glass of Douro to atone for the misstep. What great service! The amount of lobster is small, as another poster mentioned. It was "half a lobster," but really about the smallest tail and claw I've ever seen.  The only less than stellar mark is the bread. Mostly stale French, with a single, fresher sourdough slice that was good with the peppery olive oil.  The dessert list was tantalizing -- I had a hard time choosing but went with the Portuguese creme brûlée.  For the first time ever, not served in a single ramekin, but large dollops dotting the plate, each with a shard of torched sugar atop. A unique citrusy quality made this one of the best versions of a favorite dessert ever!

In town for a conference and, after a long day in sessions, an enjoyable meal is a must. And with so many great options to choose from in Montreal, I am very pleased we decided on this spot! The service was excellent, the food was delightful, and, well, the service was excellent! While predominantly focused on seafood, the vegetarian risotto was amazing and my friend definitely enjoyed her grilled fish - which came out whole (head and all) and our lovely waitress  proceeded to expertly debone and prepare it at the table (see pic for reference). I rarely eat fish and even I enjoyed my bite! Would definitely recommend this spot, especially for seafood lovers.

Our first night in Montreal (the night France won the World Cup) we went, late, to Ferreira, sat outside and shared the seafood appetizer. It was exceptional. Add a couple of glasses of Champaigne and it adds up to a perfect evening.

A wonderful experience. Expensive, but worth it, perhaps for a special night out. I started with the crispy octopus and followed that with the seafood casserole. Both were perfect; perfect texture, perfect presentation and perfect balance of flavors. This place is absolutely worth your time and money.

The food was good, but the service was a little snooty.  I mean, we are stupid Americans, but part of being in Montreal is that they also speak English.  It was a little bit of a turn off when the wait staff gave a little attitude when we didn't speak French.  On the food side, my stomach was quite satisfied with the seafood stew. They presented it in a such a way that they did the plating tableside.  I was so hungry that I just wanted them to give me the freaking pot, but it made for a cool video.

The outside tables were too small and close together. The steak was good, but we had to ask for bread when the other tables for it immediately. The shrimp was very difficult to eat. It was cut in half and I had to dig it out by hand. Thank goodness the people at the tables beside us were nice. Otherwise, we'd have left.

Wow! If this is how you eat in Portugal, put me on a plane. Seafood for two was perfect--everything tender. Scallops are so easy to mess up. Fries were delish. The roasted vegetables were excellent. And the mushroom side was also great. A little wait before they took our order, and a little slow to refill our water, but overall good service.

Came here with my partner to have dinner. He got the Quail stuffed with sweet bread served with foie gras on toast; while I had the Duck confit on Risotto. The duck confit was tender and nicely done. However, I was very disappointed with the Risotto. It was very salty and also not done. My partner's quail was better in my opinion. The foie gras was probably my favourite though. Rich and great on the bread. The atmosphere of the restaurant is dim and cozy. Next time I would try more of their seafood just to see if there's a difference.
Incredible seafood.   Started with the grilled octopus and graduated to black cod.  Both spectacular.  Also they were great with Portuguese wine suggestions.

The restaurant was full and the hostess found me a spot on the bar. I was skeptical at first but catch of the day fish was amazingly well done surrounded by great accompanying ingredients.The only small detail the reason why not 5 was the attention to details from servers who forgot to serve me bread or offer any of the usual pepper, salt etc.
Love this placeTry the late night menuIt's many dishes from regular menu but half the priceAdd a lobster when in season

I tend to overlook bad experiences and just never go back, but I felt compelled to create an account to leave a review after tonight's dinner because the service was so terrible. We walked into the restaurant and it took 5 minutes to seat us. They gave us one menu between the two of us. Despite having asked for another menu twice, we never got it. It took half an hour before someone came back to take our order. We ordered a coke (no alcohol on the patio), the scallop and blood sausage spring roll, the cornbread crusted cod, and the vegetable risotto. Shortly afterward, we got served 3 stale dinner roles and a flat glass of coke ($3.75). The table next to us got a different type of bread. I hope theirs was fresh...It was another hour before we got our food. The table next to us arrived later and got their appetizer before us. First, they got the vegetable risotto wrong and gave us the seafood paella. My friend was served his cod, only to have it swapped for a different cod dish. (As it turns out, the first dish he was served was the correct one.) We later witness the messed up order was for intended for the other table, who again would have gotten their order first if it wasn't for the mess up. The appetizer and the original cod dish (which we took a bite of before it was taken away) was delicious. As was the vegetable risotto. The "corrected" cod dish was full of bones. The entire meal was 95 for two people. We will not be returning.

I was hoping for a spot with a Portuguese feel, however apart for one really cute and colorful wall of china and clay, the place was much more loungy than Portuguese.  Ferreira has a feel that's desperately being phased out by most major cities, including club music pumping through the speakers and the whole place illuminated and decorated in lounge type decor.  They may also have an unspoken agenda of getting people to wear least amount of clothes because it was very stealthy and hot inside.  After sitting down, I still had high hopes for the food, however, like my first step inside, my first bite of the crudo dispersed these.  It was completely off balance and really needed acidity and seasoning.  The one saving grace of the meal was the bouillabaisse.  The fish and seafood were cooked well and the broth was seasoned nicely.  It may be a place for some but on my next trip to Monrteal I'll be passing on dinner at Ferreira's.

good place to take a date - professional service, fancy decor, tasty, great $24 fixed menu after 10pm (a bit late!) but pricey, not a super appealing selection of food. mainly seafood, large wine selection. ordered the fish soup (tomato-based - big bowl but small portion) and cod appetizer (beautiful presentation, fresh fish, small portion), which were OK but not memorable. at least $30 per person food only, nice open kitchen

I liked the place a lot. WE arrived pretty late (at 9:30pm) and the place was still quite full. The food came with a very nice presentation and was very tasty. I got the grilled octopus and the fish of the day that was corvina. Very well cooked and with nice flavors. I would go back if I'm in town again

Might have been the best meal I've had in Montreal (or perhaps that would be Toque). The octopus first course with the smoky eggplant puree was exquisitely prepared and presented, with a crispy outside and perfectly delicate texture. Also, the generous portion makes it perfect to share. My husband had the grouper prepared in a Portuguese style (tomatoes and other vegetables and small white potatoes), and I had two types of salt cod and both dishes were the kind of complex and distinct flavors that you taste every morsel, but the dishes also work together as a whole. Who knew what mint could do! The service was attentive, well-informed and professional. And in a charming coincidence, the couple at the next table were also out-of-towners....from our neighborhood! So we became acquainted and had a lively conversation. We will most definitely visit Ferreira again.

This place came recommended, which probably sharpened the disappointment.  If it wasn't a $200 dinner for two, I'd rate it 3 stars, but at this price the bar gets raised.The food: My mushroom risotto wasn't bad... it just tasted a bit watery, and had NO salt in it at all. Cooking 101 fail.  My SO had the '3 meat' combo, which was decent, but nothing to write home about. Maybe we should have gone for the salted cod, but something in me rebelled against paying that much for salted fish.The service: They clearly hire their waitresses for the kind of body that can fit in a hot pink slinky dress, because that's about all they are good for.  Once our drinks were served, the waitress ignored us for close to an hour while we waited for the appetizer. At this point (yes, after close to an hour), a basket of not super fresh rolls was thrown on the table with a saucer of olive oil.  Service 101: if you make your customers wait for an hour, throw them a bone (I mean some warm rolls) to hold them over. The ambiance: on the trendy side but unmemorable.  There were a lot of guys in suits at dinner on a Sunday night, which was a bit weird, as you just don't see people dressing up for dinner that much any more.Verdict: overpriced and overrated.
incredible meal..beyond great service! awesome atmosphere... accommodating to vegetarians and meat eaters alike.highly recommend

Came to in to Montreal for the famously busy and usually extravagant F1 Grand Prix weekend. We decided to go to dinner to this Portuguese restaurant on Peel that everyone is talking about - especially our hotel concierge. Both seafood and steaks are great choices here, and their drink menu is fantastic. I had the Grilled Octopus appetizer and my husband had the salmon tartare - both were amazing, however the grilled octopus was out of this world and an absolute must if I ever return.  As a main, I enjoyed my order  of Black Cod - probably the best I ever had and a great recommendation by the waiter. We also enjoyed a Pinot Noir from Oregon (of al places), that paired perfectly.  Again, another suggestion by our waiter who was spot on...

We've been to Portugal several times and have eaten some wonderful meals there. Having said that, Ferreira Cafe takes Portuguese cuisine to another level...a more refined riff on traditional favorites. We had the sardine appetizer and found it flavorful and balanced. My entree, porcini crusted cod, was the definition of umami. My husband had the fresh Porgi which was deboned tableside by the waitstaff and served with an excellent warm couscous salad. The service was attentive without being overbearing. The bartender knew exactly how to mix a cocktail we had while in Porto and the wine and Port selection was extensive.   The atmosphere was relaxing and well designed. We found street parking even on a Monday evening but it took a few minutes. We highly recommend this dining experience.

Seafood (Portuguese heritage) close by Metro Rue Peel (The Peel station on the Montreal Metro's Green Line near the corner of Peel & De Maisonneuve Blvd. West).Excellent service (Alexandre)!Favorites: Calamari, Octopus.House wine by the glass better than most.LeBlon caipirinha good enough.(Hoping for simpler pinga, or perhaps Boazinha or Vale de Verde next time.)Tasty (mas muito caro) salada de tomate & mozzarella. Ask for price.Excellent experience, but at 9 pm, perhaps shift from hard beat toward Portuguese fado, or Brazilian (ceu, cibelle, marise, astrud), or even forro.

Absolute perfection!My fiance took me here for my birthday Sept 2012. I loved everything about this place. The service was classy and the food was served steaming hot without too long of a wait. The dishes were phenomenal! The red wines by the glass also paired well with the dishes.We ordered:Orzo and duck (the flavors in this dish are so rich I can't begin to describe them)Fish of the day (fiance ordered this, he basically refused to share because he loved it so much but I remember having a bite and it was cooked to perfection)** One small complaint was that they gave us our leftovers in some fancy bag that had to be held with 2 hands. If you held it by the handle (which I ended up doing) it leaked.

Fantastic food, great service, wonderful atmosphere and strong signature cocktails. We had the bouillabaisse, duo lamb, tuna tartare, Portuguese creme brûlée and for drinks "the derby". I would encourage everyone to visit Ferreira Cafe for a great dining experience.

(see explanation of ratings below)Not your daddy's Portuguese place.  This is upscale, hip and loud.Love the leggy, lovely waitresses.Try the sardines: large and tasty.The risotto is to die for: served with a leg of duck confit.About $90 per person, booze included, no dessert, excluding tip.Chef spends a lot of time in the dining room.About my ratings:Only high-priced dining establishments can garner five stars.  Until yelp realizes that a fast food joint cannot possibly be ranked equally with a $100 per person place, I need to draw the line somewhere.  If we were only talking about the quality and presentation of the food, it would be a different story.  But, as we know, yelp's rankings take into account the entire dining experience.Therefore, I divide restaurants into three categories (and I wish yelp would do the same):1) fast food and "fast-casual", low-priced (no table service).2) casual, mid-priced dining (table service, average entrée price: $10-$20).3) fine, high-priced dining (linen napkins, no plastic cups, no TV's in dining room, average entrée priced at more than $20, can vary depending on the city).High-priced dining can earn a max of five stars.  Mid-priced dining can earn a max of four stars.  Fast food can earn a max of three stars.
Delicious food, had Arctic char and gal had grilled octopus.  Beautiful looking restaurant. Only drawback was server who spoke to much and attempted to much upselling.

Came here for dinner from a reservation from a local. Absolutely delicious!Had the sardines bruschetta for app.Seafood rice paella, husband had sea bass, we shared chorizo, sautéed vegetables and broccoli rabe sides. Espresso and pasteis de Natas for dessert. Perfect night out and the kind service made it even better! Will come back next visit to Montreal!
This place is excellent its sofisticated and traditional Portuguese food is top. You can see the active cooks and chefs as they have an open kitchen, all products  are fresh

Amazing! Highly recommend I usually don't eat fish but the waiter recommended I try the cod, I did not regret it. I had forgotten fish could taste this good, worth the price.They also have a good wine selection.The ambiance is very nice, it's calm, you can enjoy your meal peacefully. (I want on a weekday, it might be different on the weekend)

Seafood in Montreal sucks the bell-end so rating a seafood restaurant here is like comparing public toilets at a festival. Seriously, how may times are we going to see the same shitty sea-bass and tilapia (raised in sewage) slathered in capers and oil to cover up the rot-aroma from it sitting on ice for an entire week? If you're from the southern US, you're going to be sorely disappointed. So, aside from that, which is unavoidable in all Montreal restaurants that serve seafood, I have to say that Ferreira is an elegant spot that runs with Cava and Milos and the rest of them. The ambience is really beautiful - there are lots of heirloom-like knickknacks, lamps, tiled wallwork, glass bar and open counters, etc etc to make the place visually very engaging. The food itself is average to good - nothing on the menu is spectacular, but they sort of do everything well and the decor distracts you into thinking you're experiencing a 5-star meal, which you're totally not. I've had way, and I mean WAY better fish at places like Fogarty's in Key West, and that's a tourist trap in the middle of a tourist street. BUT the overall package is pretty good. A few gripes - mixed meat plates with chorizo, bavette strips, and chicken wings (grand total of $5 of supermarket meat) going for $60 are a bit annoying, as is the waiter waxing poetic about how fresh the sea bass is today (no it's not, the eyes on that fish are clouded over like a muslim cleric in an Al-Qaeda video).Anyways, go try it out. It's definitely pretty.
This was my fifth time here. There is not much to be said - other than this place is absolutely INCREDIBLE. Ambiance, decor, food, wine, service - all top notch PERIOD.

I can't comment on the food first hand, as I didn't dine there (but my parents reported it was delicious and the service was great); I did speak with Charlotte to make some arrangements for my parents meal, and she was fantastic.  The Ferreira team did exactly as I asked, and followed up with me afterwards as promised. I love anywhere with pleasant, helpful staff and great customer service (plus pictures of the food looked amazing) - will definitely visit if ever in Montreal. Thank you, Charlotte!

The new management has really got it wrong with its new "headwear" policy for clients.  Myself and other patrons find it inappropriate & too uptight for the Montreal market.  Instead of focusing on what clients are wearing, the management should concentrate on the quality of the food and the uptight service.  I could go on complaining about the cocktails and how lousy the food was prepared, but I want to concentrate on the "new restaurant policies" that are just not represented of Montreal.  It was a very unpleasant experience and will not be returning anytime soon.  I also think I need an apology for this rude behaviour of the management.  Thanks Rene

Perfect from start to finish. Service was friendly and helpful. Suggested wine, spot-on for our palate. Oysters to start, then a main of whole John Dory. Porto and creme brulee after dinner. The only think we would have done differently is to get the raw oysters rather than the baked Portuguese-style, but we wanted to give them a try. I was at this restaurant five years ago, and this experience lived up to my memory of it. Thank you for a fabulous evening!

I had a halibut filet. It was good but nothing fabulous and for 40$ I was expecting fabulous. My husband got the mushroom and duck risotto. That was very good, rich and golden with a confit duck leg and oyster mushrooms, well worth the 36$.Our friend got the bouillabaisse. It was delicious but smallish for the price.
Excellent food and attentive service. I had the black cod and my husband the lamb stew, which he loved and I'll try next time.

There are so many restaurants to choose from in this city!!  So, where do you turn to if you aren't sure where to go....Yelp of course!  The recommendations were stellar and we were not steered wrong!Travel day to Montreal for work...and its my birthday away from home, but I'm happy to be with great friends.  We make the trek up Rue Peel, luggage in tow - all up hill mind you.  "Should only be about 4 blocks, oh ok only 2 more blocks, well it should be up this block.  Oye, worn out from our hike our hunger was almost outta control.We arrived and the hostess gladly handled our bags by putting them in coat check, swiftly got us seated and immediately we were asked about our beverage to start the evening.  Not being familiar with their wine selection the sommelier Victor offered up a taste of a wonderful red Quinta Do Crasto '06.History: Quinta do Crasto revolutionized Douro winemaking. From a traditional blend of touriga nacional, tinta roriz, touriga franca and the hearty tinta barroca comes a vibrant red with perfect cherry fruit, embellished with caraway, cedar, leather and fennel notes. Medium weight and juicy, with excellent length. Drink now or age five years.  We drank it now and it was very good!!The starter was 4 roasted sardines topped with fleur de sel seated on an olive tapenade and served with toasted bread.  The sardine melted in your mouth, the salt and olive tapenade gave balance and seasoning and the bread provided the host for this tasty treat.My entree was the Black Cod accompanied by a seafood risotto.  Ok, I have never had such a well prepared dish that made me want to order seconds, thirds and a doggy bag!  The fish was cooked to perfection and was topped with a nice parsley garlic puree  The risotto was creamy with ample clams and mussels throughout.   My friends had Cataplana fish and seafood bouillabaisse and seared tuna, smashed potatoes with foie gras --- considering there was no noise except for the constant humm of 3 happy diners I was fully confident their dishes were as good as mine.Thankfully or regrettably there was a second round of bread brought to the table so we all were able to soak up our respective sauces and broth...needless to say no bread remained.Dessert, like we needed it, included a coconut milk tapioca with pineapple marmalade (sooo smooth and creamy) and an order of Portugese vanilla tarts served with a scoop of the most intense coffee ice cream I've had.This was a fabulous meal, outstanding service and a go to restaurant for me whenever I come back into the city!  Thank you Victor for the introduction to a wonderful wine selection!!

Great place. Went there half a dozen time now, always with the same pleasure. On the expensive side but worth it3 startersGrilled CalamaryFresh sardinesCarpaccio de pulpo1 glass of Douro wine ( white )$Can 66
Excellent food with generous portions. Vibe is nice, but not on the trendy side and slightly older crowd. Hot servers who were not the most attentive.

Excellent service and perfectly executed food in a lovely space. I also appreciated being able to hear  my companion's voice from across our table, despite being packed with people.  A big thank you to the aesthetically pleasing sound insulation panels... De-licious and De-lovely

Came here hoping for a nice break from our usual French/American dining. The 10pm dinner menu (set for $24) looked very appealing. We arrived around 9:45p. Our waitress, after seating us down, did not bother coming back to our table until it was past 10pm. No water. Nothing. She kept serving all the other clients except us. Another thing I disliked was the decor. Since it is a huge place, the modern decor felt very impersonal. The fuchsia light gave it a clubby feel. Plus the AC was on blast! At the end I couldn't wait to leave. On to food. I ordered the grilled calamari, which was kind of bland. My black cod topped with very thin french fries was delicious. I didn't appreciate the black olive in the bottom. My fiance loved his organic chicken though it came with few veggies.All and all, Ferreira did not meet the romantic & intimate vibe I was expecting. I would recommend to still try their signature dishes.

Not sure if it was the wrong choice of food ordered, but expected more of a wow, than what we got; especially after the place was raved about by the hotel concierge.  Wish that the server was more attentive and guided us in the choices we made.  Good, but not excellent.
